definition: horse/CL:匹[pi3]/horse or cavalry piece in Chinese chess/knight in Western chess
surname Ma/abbr. for Malaysia 馬來西亞|马来西亚[Ma3 lai2 xi1 ya4]
to come/to arrive/to come round/ever since/next

sentences.english: Malays are by constitutional definition, Muslims.
sentences.chinese: 马来人根据宪法的定义应该是穆斯林。

sentences.english: Only 5% is given to non-Malays for government scholarships over 40 years.
sentences.chinese: 只有5%的政府奖学金是提供给非马来人的。

sentences.english: In the Permatang Pauh by-election, 70% of the voters were Malays .
sentences.chinese: 然而在峇东埔补选中，70%的选民是马来人。

sentences.english: Most members of some professions, such as medicine and law, were non-Malay.
sentences.chinese: 某些职业中，例如医药和法律，大部分都是非马来人。

sentences.english: The Indonesia Pribumis (Malay) comprises over 80% of the total population.
sentences.chinese: 印泥的马来人占总人口的80%。

sentences.english: Malays in white skull caps wear DAP T-shirts.
sentences.chinese: 戴着白色头巾的马来人身穿行动党T恤。

sentences.english: Malays and other races are counted as Non-Singaporean by them.
sentences.chinese: 在他们看来，马来人和其他种族的人是非新加坡人。

definition: Peranakan Chinese (Baba-Nyonya), an ethnic group of Chinese residing in the Malay peninsula (also known as Straits Chinese)
black dwarf (pejorative term for non-Han people)
Maori, indigenous Polynesian people of New Zealand
